Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells were treated with siRNA for DJ-1 knockdown and exposed to hydrogen peroxide, MPP+, and 6-hydroxydopamine.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells with L166P mutation showed increased susceptibility to oxidative stress and neurotoxicants.
DJ-1 deletion resulted in significant cell death under stress conditions.

Biological replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Technical replicates.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1-expressing cells served as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells transfected with empty vector served as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the text.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No specific threshold described; normal function inferred by lack of cell death under stress.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant cell death (>50% mortality) under stress conditions.
